intro: Eriostemon brevifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eriostemon, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
